item.title: Japanese Charts: Konami Rolls Another Smash Hit With Its Momotaro Dentetsu Board Game Sequel
item.content:encoded:
It's time to take another look at the Japanese physical gaming charts, courtesy of Famitsu, and if you thought that Nintendo's latest joint would be hanging around in the top spot for more than one week, think again. There's a new Momotaro Dentetsu game in town, and it's another smash hit.

The Japanese exclusive Momotaro Dentetsu 2: Anata no Machi mo Kitto Aru – Higashi Nihon Hen + Nishi Nihon Hen has arrived with a bang on Switch and Switch 2, snatching up first and third spots on the software charts with a combined first week total of 147,513 sales. Oof.

If you've been following these charts for a while, you'll remember that Konami's first Momotaro Dentetsu board game took Japan by storm back in late 2020, even beating Age of Calamity to the top spot — these Hyrule Warriors games can't catch a break against the Japan-exclusive series, can they?

Mario Kart World managed to sneak in and grab second place, but this all means that Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment, last week's champion, has fallen to sixth.

Things are rounded out by newbies Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 and DRAGON BALL: Sparking! ZERO, which managed to nab the last three spots.

Here's the latest top ten physical sales in Japan:

item.title: Steins;Gate Re:Boot Western Release Confirmed for 2026, More Info Revealed
item.content:encoded:
Publisher Spike Chunsoft has announced that upcoming visual novel remake Steins;Gate Re:Boot will be making its way to the West in 2026, and the company has shown off some of the changes coming to the revamped version of the classic game as well.

In a news post on its official website, Spike Chunsoft says that a North American and European release of Steins;Gate Re:Boot is on the cards for next year, although the publisher stops short of announcing a specific month.

The game, which was originally announced last year, will serve as an enhanced remake of Steins;Gate, a visual novel that made its debut on the Xbox 360 all the way back in 2009. It'll feature "updated visuals and new narrative content", according to Spike Chunsoft.

The new version of Steins;Gate will boast fresh character art by freelance artist Ryohei Fuke, also known as Huke, as well as new event stills "produced under Huke's supervision".

You can also look forward to brand new background art that aims to stay faithful to the way the game's Akihabara setting would have looked in 2010, "created using extensive reference materials", according to Spike Chunsoft.

New locations have been added to Steins;Gate Re:Boot in order to "complement and enrich the story", and new scenes have been added to "further a sense of immersion". Event stills have been reworked from the game's original storyboards to "deliver greater dramatic impact".

As well as all of the above, Steins;Gate Re:Boot will also boast a reworked UI that should make navigating the game a little easier. All told, it sounds like Mages and Spike Chunsoft are angling to make this the definitive version of Steins;Gate.

You'll be able to check out Steins;Gate Re:Boot when it launches on PC next year. If you want to keep up with the game's progress, you can wishlist it on Steam right now.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Opus: Prism Peak Delayed to March 2026
item.content:encoded:
Developer Sigono and publisher Shueisha Games have announced that upcoming narrative adventure game Opus: Prism Peak has been delayed once again, but at least we now know in which month it'll be launching next year.

Per a new post on Steam, Opus: Prism Peak will now be arriving in March 2026. It was originally slated for a 2025 release, but Sigono says that more time is needed to ensure the game "reaches the level of quality [the studio is] aiming for".

Sigono says the extra development time will allow it to polish the game further and ensure it's in a fit state for launch. It's a pretty standard reason for games to be delayed, but hey - what's that oft-misattributed quote about delayed games and rushed games, again?

Opus: Prism Peak is the latest title in Sigono's Opus series of narrative adventure games, which began in 2016 with Opus: The Day We Found Earth, followed by 2018's Rocket of Whispers and 2021's Echo of Starsong.

The games are loosely connected to one another by theme and atmosphere, but they don't tell a continuous story, so you won't need to have played previous Opus games to get the most out of Prism Peak when it eventually arrives.

In Opus: Prism Peak, you'll play as a photographer stranded in a place known as the Dusklands alongside a mysterious young girl who's lost her memories. As you find your way home, you'll uncover the mysteries of the Dusklands and of your companion as well.

Like previous Opus entries, you shouldn't expect high-octane action from this one; it'll be a contemplative narrative-led experience with an emphasis on photography, dialogue, and exploration.

Opus: Prism Peak is set to launch across PC, Switch 2, and Switch in March next year. You can try out a demo for the game on Steam right now if you want to get a feel for what it'll be like.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Total War: Warhammer III Immortal Empires Is Being Made Free for Owners of the First Two Games
item.content:encoded:
Creative Assembly and Sega have announced that owners of Total War: Warhammer I or II (or both, of course) will soon be able to play Total War: Warhammer III's Immortal Empires campaign for free.

In a blog post on the official Creative Assembly website, the developer says that starting from December 4th, all owners of the first two games in the Total War: Warhammer series will gain access to Immortal Empires and its The Lost God prologue campaign at no extra cost.

What's more, even if you don't own Total War: Warhammer III, you can still buy Immortal Empires-related DLC to play extra factions in the campaign mode, since you'll access the campaign through a new listing in your library (assuming you don't own the third game, of course).

Naturally, if you already own Total War: Warhammer III, then nothing will change for you, but this should make it easier for you to recruit some friends to enjoy Immortal Empires alongside.

This update also doesn't include any of Total War: Warhammer III's other content, so if you want to play the Realms of Chaos campaign or experience any of the Legendary Lords, you'll need to buy the Upgrade Pack, which contains the aforementioned features, plus a couple of extras.

As a reminder, the Immortal Empires campaign for Total War: Warhammer III launched in beta back in August 2022, eventually releasing in full for owners of the game the following February.

Creative Assembly describes Immortal Empires as a "vast sandbox campaign encompassing the entire Warhammer world" and "the culmination of the entire Total War: Warhammer series, so it's not just an extra; it's essentially the flagship feature of the newest game.

Total War: Warhammer III's Immortal Empires campaign is available now to everyone who owns the game on Steam, and it's also coming to owners of Warhammer I and II on December 4th.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: New Chromebooks will come with a year of Nvidia’s cloud gaming ‘fast pass’
item.content:encoded:
Dominic Preston

is a news editor with over a decade’s experience in journalism. He previously worked at Android Police and Tech Advisor.

Nvidia has partnered with Google to launch a new cloud gaming plan exclusive to Chromebooks. GeForce Now Fast Pass will allow Chromebook owners to stream over 2,000 games directly from an existing PC game library without ads, and new Chromebook purchases will include a year’s membership for free.

Fast Pass looks similar to GeForce Now’s existing free plan, which includes the ability to stream more than 2,000 “Ready-to-Play” titles from a user’s existing Steam, Epic, or Xbox libraries. Unlike that plan, the companies say Fast Pass “has no ads,” and “allows you to skip the queue,” compared to typical waits of two minutes or more to start playing on the free plan.

There are other restrictions, with Fast Pass users limited to 10 hours of cloud gaming each month. Up to five of those can roll over to the next month if you don’t use them up though. Nvidia’s other paid plans, which start at $9.99 per month, support a variety of other features, including higher resolutions, faster frame rates, RTX ray-tracing, and access to a larger game library bolstered by a couple of thousand “Install-to-Play” titles that must be installed onto Nvidia’s servers before you can access them.

Google says that anyone who purchases a new Chromebook will now get one year of GeForce Now Fast Pass included. The companies haven’t confirmed how much Fast Pass will cost outside of that offer.

Follow topics and authors from this story to see more like this in your personalized homepage feed and to receive email updates.

  • Dominic Preston


https://www.theverge.com/news/824940/chromebooks-nvidia-geforce-now-fast-pass-free-year

item.title: Nex Playground Motion-Controlled Gaming Console Hits an All-Time Low as Amazon Clears Out Remaining Stock After Selling 10K+ Last Month
item.content:encoded:
The 2000s had the EyeToy. The 2010s had the Kinect. And now the 2020s have the Nex Playground. This play system will get you and the whole family up from the couch, moving and grooving while you play a variety of awesome games. Thanks to Amazon’s Black Friday, you can grab the Nex Playground on sale. It’s currently 20% off. That brings the price down from $249 to just $199, saving you an even $50. That ends up being less than half the price of the new Nintendo Switch 2 console.

See at Amazon

Get Up and Moving to Play

The Nex Playground is a plug-and-play gaming console built around motion controls. No controller necessary because your body is the controller. Just connect it to your TV over HDMI with the front camera pointed toward a space you’ve cleared enough in front of it for you to move around in. Depending on the game, up to four players can be up and out of their seats to play along together.

Out of the box, you’ll have access to five fun games. This includes Fruit Ninja, Go Keeper, Party Fowl, Whac-a-Mole, and Starri. This may be enough to keep you entertained, but you can dive into a huge library of even more games with the Nex Playground Play Pass. Yu’ll gain access to new games each month, some of which feature famous and beloved characters from Barbie, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, How to Train Your Dragon, Peppa Pig, Care Bears, Elmo, Miraculous Ladybug, Gabby’s Dollhouse, Kung Fu Panda and more. The full catalog includes over 30 games.

The Play Pass can be purchased separately from you Nex Playground. The three-month pass can be acquired for $49 while a full-year pass is set at $89. That works out to just a little over $7 per month. That cheaper than most streaming services go for nowadays. One Play Pass can be used on up to two Nex Playgrounds in the same household. Great for if you have one in the living room and then one in either a finished basement or kid’s bedroom.

The Nex Playground is safe for kids and families as all content is made to be appropriate for all ages. No mature content, no in-app purchases, but best of all the system has no ads. It’s nice to be able to boot up a smart device in the year 2025 without being bombarded with advertising.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/this-motion-controlled-gaming-console-the-nex-playground-is-under-200-at-amazon-2000634139

item.title: Roborock Q10 S5+ Drops 53% Off, Amazon Wants Every Unit Gone From Black Friday Day One
item.content:encoded:
The Roborock Q10 S5+ became Roborock’s best-selling model within hours of Black Friday starting and that makes perfect sense when you see the pricing. This robot vacuum and mop combo just dropped to a record low of $259 on Amazon, down from its usual $549 (53% off) while most other Roborock models sit between $600 and $1,000 even with Black Friday discounts.

Roborock built its reputation as a premium brand that competes directly with high-end options from iRobot and Ecovacs and their performance typically commands premium pricing. Robot vacuums solve the eternal problem of maintaining clean floors without dedicating hours to manual vacuuming and mopping each week. The Q10 S5+ combines 10,000Pa suction, 70-day self-emptying capacity, sonic mopping, and intelligent obstacle avoidance.

See at Amazon

70 Days of Truly Hands-Free Floor Cleaning

The self-emptying station holds a 2.7-liter dust bag that stores debris for as long as 70 days before needing replacement. This capacity eliminates the weekly ritual of emptying dustbins that plagues basic robot vacuums and standard self-emptying models with smaller bags. Pet owners, in particular, benefit from the extended capacity since pet hair builds up fast and fills smaller dust containers in days. The station automatically empties the robot’s dustbin after each cleaning session, so you never touch dust or allergens during normal operation.

The 10,000Pa HyperForce suction is serious cleaning power that pulls embedded pet hair from carpets, lifts crumbs from hardwood grooves, and extracts debris from tile grout lines. This is much stronger than many upright vacuums provide and means this robot can deeply clean rather than just lightly maintain surfaces. Power is automatically adjusted based on floor type and debris detection and rampus up on carpets and dialing it back on hard floors to balance cleaning performance against battery life. A dual anti-tangle system utilizes a JawScrapers comb on the main brush, combined with specialized side brush design to prevent hair wrapping that stops cheaper robots dead in their tracks mid-clean.

The VibraRise 2.0 mopping system scrubs floors with sonic vibration at 3,000 oscillations per minute which generates actual cleaning action rather than just dragging a damp cloth across surfaces. This type of sonic scrubbing picks up dried spills, sticky residue, and ground-in dirt that static mopping systems leave behind. When transitioning onto carpets, it lifts the mop pad up to 8 mm and saves wet mopping pads from soaking rugs or carpet edges.

ReactiveTech obstacle avoidance uses structured light technology that detects objects in its path and navigates with precision around them. The system identifies shoes, cables, pet toys, and furniture legs without bumping into them or getting stuck. This obstacle detection works in low-light conditions where camera-based systems struggle, maintaining reliable navigation during nighttime cleaning sessions.

PreciSense LiDAR navigation scans rooms 360 degrees to create detailed maps that enable efficient cleaning patterns. It also supports multi-level mapping, remembering layouts for different floors in multi-story homes. The robot will plan an optimal cleaning route that can minimize the area of repeated coverage and reduce cleaning time. You can set no-go zones, invisible walls, and schedules for specific rooms with the Roborock app, giving you granular control over where and when the robot cleans.

At $259, the Roborock Q10 S5+ is less than half price while delivering features and performance that usually require spending upwards of $600. The fact that this became Roborock’s Black Friday bestseller in a matter of hours proves that buyers recognize exceptional value when premium performance falls to mid-tier pricing.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/roborock-q10-s5-drops-53-off-amazon-wants-every-unit-gone-from-black-friday-day-one-2000645764

item.title: Battlefield REDSEC Elite Series Announced with $1 Million Prize Pot
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6’s battle royale mode, REDSEC, is getting an esports competition, the Elite Series, featuring a $1 million prize pool in the first season from December 10 to January 18.

The Battlefield REDSEC Elite Series will kick off on December 10, 2025. Alongside the Elite Series, we will also see the launch of Open Series on December 12, 2025. The Open Series will be a competition for players of all skill levels, whereas the Elite Series will be the best REDSEC has to offer in the competitive phase. All competitions will feature cross-platform and cross-input environments, with players able to use a controller or mouse & keyboard on PC or console.

How Does Battlefield REDSEC Elite Series Work?

The new Elite Series will feature weekly competitive cash cups divided across three regions: The Americas, Europe/Middle East/Africa (EMEA), and Asia-Pacific (APAC). 50 team captains from each region will be invited, each with a squad of 4, for a total of 600 competitors.

These 50 squads will go through a series of six REDSEC Battle Royale matches, which will end with the top eight squads battling head-to-head in a gauntlet. The format will be repeated over three Qualifying Match Days, with squads earning Elite Series Points for their performance. After this period, the top-25 squads will progress to the regional Season Finals.

All matches will be online, streamed by all competitors, and Battlefield Studios will host the Season Finals broadcast for each region. The Americas region will have a $50,000 USD prize pool for each Qualifying Match Day, as well as a $500,000 USD prize pool split across all participating squads in the Finals Gauntlet. The APAC and EMEA regions will have a $20,000 USD prize pool for each Qualifying Match Day, and a $285,000 USD prize pool for the Finals Gauntlet.

Battlefield REDSEC Elite Series Season 1 Schedule

The start time for each season will be announced closer to the Qualifying match day, but here are the Match Day and Season Finals dates:

  • Match Day #1 – Wednesday, December 10, 2025
  • Match Day #2 – Thursday, December 11, 2025
  • Match Day #3 – Tuesday, December 16, 2025
  • Season Finals – Thursday, December 18, 2025

How Does Battlefield REDSEC Open Series Work?

The Open Series will also be held in the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. Players can register their squads on Repeat.gg (see the blog for more details), and on each match day, they can find the tournament code in the Repeat App. Scoring will be based on the cumulative 10 best Battle Royale and the 10 best Gauntlet matches played across all three Match Days. The top 250 teams will qualify from each region for the Season Finals, and the top 8 teams will qualify for next season’s Elite Series.

Open Series will feature a $30,000 prize pool, with $10,000 reserved for each region.

Battlefield REDSEC Open Series Schedule

Just like the Elite Series, the Open Series start times will be announced close to the day, but here are the Match Day and Season Finals dates:

  • Match Day #1 – Friday, December 12, 2025
  • Match Day #2 – Friday, December 19, 2025
  • Match Day #3 – Friday, January 9, 2026
  • Season Finals – Saturday, January 17, 2026

In other news, Battlefield 6 has broken the franchise sales record in just its first month. Additionally, the title will be free to play from November 25 for one week. What are your thoughts on Battlefield REDSEC Elite Series season 1? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Resident Evil Requiem reportedly having ‘definitely’ one DLC in development. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Surprise! Silent Hill 2 Remake Shadow Drops on Xbox Series X/S With 50% Launch Discount
item.content:encoded:
It's happening — the brilliant Silent Hill 2 Remake is finally arriving on Xbox Series X/S, and it's being released with a hefty 50% launch discount.

Fans have spotted that the game is already available to purchase via the Xbox Store in Australia, where it's already Friday, November 21. Store pages for the game in other regions are also available, though the game cannot yet be purchased elsewhere.

When it does become available — likely when midnight passes tonight — the game looks to have launched at half price. The Australian version has a recommended retail price of AU $99, currently reduced to AU $50, which is something at least after the long wait.

As of yet, publisher Konami is yet to make the launch official, though we are just hours away from Microsoft's impending Xbox Partner Preview showcase, where the console maker is set to detail a raft of new third-party announcements. You can tune into that later today, Thursday, November 20 from 10am Pacific, 1pm Eastern, or 6pm UK time.

Silent Hill 2 Remake has been available since October 2024 on PC and PlayStation 5, though its eventual arrival on Xbox Series X/S has long been expected. Last month, a new Xbox version of the game popped up on the Entertainment Software Rating Board (ESRB), suggesting it was finally almost time — and here we are.

Silent Hill 2 Remake has sold 2.5 million worldwide, something which has propelled sales of the overall franchise past the 10 million mark. IGN's Silent Hill 2 Remake review returned an 8/10. We said: "Silent Hill 2 is a great way to visit – or revisit – one of the most dread-inducing destinations in the history of survival horror."

Tom Phillips is IGN's News Editor. You can reach Tom at tom_phillips@ign.com or find him on Bluesky @tomphillipseg.bsky.social



https://www.ign.com/articles/surprise-silent-hill-2-remake-shadow-drops-on-xbox-series-xs-with-50-launch-discount

item.title: Clive Barker’s Hellraiser: Revival ‘Gameplay’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

One minute of new footage.

Saber Interactive has released a one-minute gameplay trailer for survival horror action game Clive Barker’s Hellraiser: Revival.

Here is an overview of the game, via Saber Interactive:

About

Experience a new chapter in the legendary horror series like never before. Clive Barker’s Hellraiser: Revival takes first-person action horror survival to the next level.

Play the story of Aidan, who must use the power of a mysterious puzzle box—the Genesis Configuration—to help his girlfriend Sunny’s escape from the otherworldly hellscape of the Labyrinth.

Wield the powers of the box to survive your bargain with the infamous Pinhead and do battle with the horrific cult devoted to the Cenobites.

Key Features

  • A New Story in Hellraiser’s Canon – Unwittingly kickstart Pinhead’s ritual to unleash greater pain and pleasure than ever before.
  • Harness the Power of the Box – Combine the unique, hellish abilities of the Configuration with an arsenal of earthly weapons to inflict bone-breaking, flesh-searing pain—or is it pleasure?—upon masochistic enemies.
  • Fight Against Unholy Enemies – Take on hell’s wretches, deviants, cultists, and even its most infernal priests in a story-driven horror survival game.

Clive Barker’s Hellraiser: Revival will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam. A release date has yet to be announced.

Watch the trailer below.

item.title: GTA Online's Long-Awaited Mansions Update Is Coming Soon
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you've been playing Grand Theft Auto Online long enough, you should have a pretty hefty amount of cash on hand. Next month, you'll be able to put that money to good use as the new update--A Safehouse in the Hills--introduces mansions that you can claim as your own.

These multi-million estates are under the purview of the Prix Luxury Real Estate company, which promises "sprawling grounds, breathtaking views, and first-rate amenities--including the latest in personal assistance and business service technology." While a price range for the mansions wasn't disclosed, players may wish they took part in the recent giveaway of free in-game currency.

Rockstar Games hasn't disclosed an exact date in December for the launch of A Safehouse in the Hills, but GTA Online players who opt into a Prix Luxury Black Tier VIP from now through December 7 can grab an Ubermacht Revolter sports car at the Luxury Autos showroom. Players can advance to the Gold Tier membership by finishing all three New Listings missions, which will reward users with a $1 million bonus of in-game cash, as well as a $2 million discount on one of the luxury estates being offered by Prix Luxury.

Rockstar hasn't signaled its intentions for GTA Online following the arrival of Grand Theft Auto 6, because GTA Online is the real cash cow of the franchise according a video game analyst. Earlier this month, Rockstar added GTA Online to its GTA+ membership service.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Co-Op Horror 'Reanimal' Launches February 2026, Demo Coming Soon
item.content:encoded:
Set your calendar

THQ Nordic and Tarsier Studios have announced that Reanimal will launch on the Switch 2 on 13th February 2026.

The highly-anticipated spiritual successor to Little Nightmares (which was also handled by Tarsier Studios before handing the reins over to Supermassive Games for the third entry) will also gain a free demo in the coming weeks, just in case you want to try it out yourself before opting for the full game.

A $59.99 Digital Deluxe Edition will be available on launch, and this will include the base game, Season Pass, and the exclusive Foxhead and Muttonhead masks. Tarsier has also stressed that while this is primarily a co-op experience, solo players can also experience the game, with an AI taking on the role of your companion.

It looks awesome, and we genuinely can't wait to dive in. For now, let's check out the key features:

- Horror With Hope – In this unsettling tale, the emphasis is on tension and thick atmosphere, as you join the two orphans on a desperate search for hope and redemption in the direst of circumstances.

- Across a Dark and Twisted World – Traverse an intriguing but terrifying world, where the main path is only one part of the fragmented story. Discover all sorts of mysterious locations on your perilous journey, each with its own story to tell.

- A Dread-Filled Adventure – Tarsier Studios is bringing their unique visual style to bear on a whole host of new twisted monsters and broken, yet resilient, child characters. Fragments of the children’s troubled past have been used as inspiration for their character design, and for the monsters that now torment them.

- Share the Scare – Nobody should be forced to go through hell alone! Fully playable in single player and local and online cooperative play, REANIMAL has a shared, directed camera, designed to maximize claustrophobia and tension.

What do you make of Reanimal from what you've seen so far? Are you keen to pick it up? Let us know.

[source store.steampowered.com]

Nintendo Life’s resident horror fanatic, when he’s not knee-deep in Resident Evil and Silent Hill lore, Ollie likes to dive into a good horror book while nursing a lovely cup of tea. He also enjoys long walks and listens to everything from TOOL to Chuck Berry.

item.title: Someone Might Have Just Bought The Last Brand-New Physical Copy Of 2008’s Spore
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! Welcome to the coolest show in town, Kotaku’s Morning Checkpoint. This is our daily roundup of video game news and other interesting stuff you might care about. Squeeze in, find a seat, and get ready to be blown away by this morning’s showcase, which includes bad news for fans of The Finals on PS4, more layoffs, Sakurai wanting to live a chill life, and more.

Some games that sold a single physical copy in October

According to data from Circana’s Matt Piscatella, some odd, old games sold exactly one new physical copy in the United States during October. If you were the person out there who bought a physical copy of Spore in October, email me a photo of the receipt. I want to talk to you about your life. I hope things turn around for you. And if you are the person who bought Incredibles 2: Rise of the Underminer on GBA last month, you are a wild individual, and I respect it. Here’s the full list:

  • 360- Burnout Paradise
  • 3DS- Carnival Games: Wild West 3D
  • GBA- Incredibles 2: Rise of the Underminer
  • NDS- Imagine Fashion Stylist
  • PC- Spore
  • PS2- Backyard Baseball
  • PS3- Hasbro Family Game Night 3
  • PS4- Cooking Mama Cookstar
  • XBX- Ultra Bust A Move

Avalanche Liverpool closes, 31 devs laid off

In September, Avalanche Liverpool, the studio behind the canceled Xbox game Contraband, announced it would be shutting down. And now that has happened. On November 19, the studio announced via its official website that it had completely closed its doors and 31 developers had been laid off as a result.

“The exceptional talent, passion, and commitment from everyone leaving have impacted every project. We are truly grateful for the dedication and invaluable contributions to Avalanche Studios Group. Our focus remains on supporting the Avalanchers through the transition and to carry on making great games for our player communities.”

Leave Smash Bros. creator Masahiro Sakurai alone

In a new interview with Game*Spark, Smash Bros. and Kirby creator Masahiro Sakurai talked about how he doesn’t consider his life all that interesting and wishes people would just focus on the games and not who made them. So he was surprised that people wanted to turn his story into a manga.

“I think I’ve always wanted to live an unassuming life,” Sakurai told the outlet, as translated by Gamesradar. “Even with [being contacted about creating the manga], I’m sure my response was something like ‘really?'”

“I try my best to communicate my work to others, but I refrain from trying to promote myself. I think I’ve always wanted to live an unassuming life. I think it’s best if people just play games, instead of looking at who made them.”

The Finals on PS4 will be shut down next year

Before Embark Studios released the massively popular Arc Raiders last month, the company published the destructive shooter The Finals across consoles and PC. It wasn’t as big of a hit, but it’s still kicking and getting updates. But not for much longer on PlayStation 4, as confirmed by the studio earlier this week.

“When Season 10 begins (18th of March, 2026), we’ll be retiring The Finals on PlayStation 4 and focusing our support on current generation hardware,” posted Embark Studios. “From that point on, you’ll need to play there to keep enjoying the game. Your progress and purchases will be stored in your Embark ID and will transfer to anywhere you choose to play. We’re incredibly grateful to everyone who’s been part of the PS4 community.”

Huh, Panic Button handled some Switch 2 port upgrades for Nintendo

Remember how, when the Switch 2 launched, some popular OG Switch games published by Nintendo, like Super Mario Odyssey, got upgrades to look and play a bit better on the new machine? Well, turns out that Switch port experts Panic Button were contracted by Nintendo to handle those upgrades.

Panic Button was honored to be selected by Nintendo to help update marquee games from the Nintendo Switch™ library. Nintendo asked us to help demonstrate new capabilities of the Nintendo Switch 2 system, while remaining faithful to the original games. pic.twitter.com/5P96V9DFUq

— Panic Button (Official) (@PanicButtonGame) November 19, 2025

I find this very interesting, as it seems like something Nintendo could have done internally. But instead, they trusted the folks at Panic to handle the upgrades. I bet Panic is feeling very good about that right now, and it will likely help the studio get even more work porting games to the new Switch 2.

ICYMI:

  • Deadpool VR is perfect…for fans of Deadpool
  • MrBeast’s new “theme park” looks…uh…not great
  • Critics seem to mostly like Kirby Air Riders

item.title: Crucial P510 SSD With Heatsink Deal Makes Storage Cost Pennies, PC and PS5 Upgrades Feel Basically Free
item.content:encoded:
For PlayStation 5 owners who regularly find themselves bumping up against the console’s limited storage, keep reading. In the lead-up to Black Friday, Crucial has cut the price of one of its PS5-compatible SSDs, making it easier and more affordable to expand your game library. The 2TB Crucial P510 Gen5 NVMe SSD normally priced around $210 has been discounted by 29%, bringing the cost down to $150. That’s a meaningful $60 reduction on a high-performance SSD equipped with its own heatsink for seamless compatibility right out of the box.

See at Amazon

PS5 & PC Compatible

One of the most common frustrations among early PS5 adopters is the reality of the console’s internal storage limitations. Even though Sony technically lists the system as having an 825GB SSD, the usable space is significantly smaller. After accounting for system files and required software, players are left with roughly 667GB for game installs—a number that feels increasingly cramped as modern titles frequently climb past 100GB each. For anyone with a growing collection, or for those who enjoy bouncing between several big releases at once, that space disappears almost immediately. Installing Crucial’s 2TB expansion effectively triples the amount of room you have to work with, reducing the need to delete old favorites just to make space for new ones.

Beyond the raw storage boost, the drive is built to meet the PS5’s demanding performance standards. With read and write speeds up of to 11,000 MB/s, the Crucial P510 far exceeds what’s needed to keep pace with Sony’s ultra-fast architecture. The included heatsink, which is required for PS5 internal installation, helps maintain stable temperatures and prevent thermal throttling during extended gaming sessions.

If you’re planning to install the Crucial P510 SSD into a PC gaming desktop, you’ll be able to make the most of its insanely fast read and write speeds. Just make sure your motherboard supports Gen5 NVMe SSDs. A Gen4 slot will still work with it, just won’t be able to reach the maximum speeds supported by the P510. With optimal conditions, you’ll be able to experience lightning fast load times in your games as well as when working with high-intensive applications such as when video or photo editing. Plus with a full 2TB, you’ll have plenty of room for not just your games, but any important pictures or vids you want to hang onto.

With its generous performance, significant storage increase, and a timely discount, Seagate’s 2TB Game Drive stands out as one of the most practical PS5 upgrades you can grab this season.

item.title: Kirby Air Riders Players Wasted No Time Creating Unhinged Vehicles
item.content:encoded:
Kirby Air Riders is out today, and it sounds like the chaotic kart racer is exactly what fans of the GameCube original wanted (and like it’s probably not for anyone else). One of the ways the Switch 2 game embraces disorder is in its vehicle customization, which lets you paint your hoverboard to look like pretty much whatever you want. Some players are using this feature to make cool karts to race around in, and others are seeing what monstrosities they can put on the market for other players to use.

Nintendo has held multiple feature-length Direct showcases for Air Riders, so we’ve already known about its vehicle customization for a while. I wouldn’t be surprised if fans were planning some of their vehicular shitposts for some time and just needed the game in their Switch 2s to finally bring them to life. But the reason that people can make vehicles that look like Chef Kawasaki in a bikini from a banned fan game (thanks, GamesRadar+) is that the toolset is so good. So for every joke, you’ll find a custom kart that actually looks pretty incredible. Y’all haven’t even had the game for a day, and you’re already killing it.

My favorites so far are the GameCube kart and the ship shaped like Latias from Pokémon, but I’m sure we’ll see some even crazier designs by day’s end. item.title: Hellraiser: Revival’s First Gameplay Trailer Is Hellish And Horrible
item.content:encoded:
The first gameplay trailer for Hellraiser: Revival has dropped, and it’s absolutely not for the faint of heart. If you thought the debut trailer was wince-worthy, this is just as nasty and as vile as you’d expect. It’s heaven, in hell.

A pleasant (also unpleasant) surprise dropped in July 2025 with a Hellraiser: Revival Trailer, revealed by Saber Interactive. It marks the first time the horror title has ever had its own standalone game, and the first gameplay trailer shows that you should expect every bit of the nastiness of the movies rolled into one.

Hellraiser: Revival Has Some Cenobite

Insider Gaming’s hands-on Gamescom preview tells you everything you need to know about Hellraiser: Revival.

An “hour-long theater of violence and sadism” was one of many lines we used. Now, you can see the evidence for yourself through the first Hellraiser: Revival gameplay trailer. It has everything a Hellraiser fan is looking for: Nudity, graphic violence, and a sprinkling of Pinhead.

There’s also a lot of visceral combat, a look into the game’s brand-new story, and you also get a look at the game’s insistence on going the extra length with platforming and puzzling.

You can check out the footage for yourself, if you dare. All jokes aside, viewer discretion is advised.

Feel free to share your thoughts on the Hellraiser gameplay trailer. Is it as bad as you thought it was going to be? The Insider Gaming Discord Server is the perfect place to discuss the trailer and the Hellraiser franchise.

For more news, check out the report that Resident Evil Requiem ‘Definitely’ Has One DLC in the Works Right Now, and Reanimal Getting Its Release Date Confirmed. You can read all of this and more right here at Insider Gaming.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem ‘Definitely’ Has One DLC in the Works Right Now, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
An insider has stated that Resident Evil Requiem is definitely getting at least one DLC, which is currently in development.

Resident Evil Requiem doesn’t arrive until next year, and as we wait for the game’s launch, the only things getting us by are leaks. We recently saw the producer address rumours about the photo of Leon Kennedy with an eye patch that surfaced online. Now, an insider has revealed some details about the DLC.

Resident Evil Requiem DLC Might Star Alyssa

The details about the Resident Evil Requiem DLC come from Dusk Golem (Aesthetic Gamer), known for RE leaks. Their latest post on X (formerly Twitter) states, “There’s definitely at least one DLC for Resident Evil Requiem in development right now. I’ve heard about it a few times, believe it stars Alyssa.” The leaker had previously stated that Alyssa Ashcroft is also the giant monster following Grace in the trailer, and will be playable for a bit in the game.

Dusk Golem was also asked on the same day whether Leon Kennedy is being considered the main character or a side character in the upcoming title. Golem replied that they don’t have a blueprint for the game to give that answer, but they do know that Leon has “some very large levels, the biggest in the series to date”. Players should take both details with a grain of salt, as it does not come from an official source.

In other news, Capcom expects Resident Evil Requiem to sell better than Resident Evil Village. Additionally, the developers recently revealed why they ditched the multiplayer aspect of the title. What are your thoughts on the new claims about Resident Evil Requiem definitely having at least one DLC in development? item.title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure sales top one million
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

500,000 units sold since March.

Total sales for open-world adventure game Hello Kitty Island Adventure have surpassed one million units just 30 days after its January 30 release for Switch and PC via Steam, developer Sunblink announced.

Hello Kitty Island Adventure first launched for Apple Arcade on July 28, 2023, followed by Switch and PC via Steam on January 30, 2025, PlayStation 5 on August 5, 2025, and Switch 2 on November 13, 2025. A PlayStation 4 version was announced, but it is unclear whether it is still planned.

Sales for Hello Kitty Island Adventure were last reported in March to have surpassed 500,000 units, just one month after its Switch and PC release.

Here is a brief overview of the game, via Sunblink:

Hello Kitty Island Adventure has redefined the “cozy adventure” genre, blending comforting activities like crafting and decorating with a vast, explorable world filled with quests, challenges and puzzle-solving. Widely celebrated by fans and critics alike, the game has been honored with Apple Arcade’s Game of the Year and a Webby People’s Voice Award, alongside major nominations including Best Mobile Game at The Game Awards 2023 and Mobile Game of the Year at the 27th Annual D.I.C.E. Awards.

In Hello Kitty Island Adventure, Hello Kitt® invites you to join her and her friends at Big Adventures Park, where My Melody™ is opening a brand-new gift shop. Express yourself as an original, Sanrio-style avatar with a wide range of adorable customization options. Cook delicious food and decorate your space with hundreds of furniture items. Share gifts and complete quests to deepen your friendship with beloved characters. Invite other players to your island and complete multiplayer challenges or build beautiful vacation homes together.

item.title: Death Howl launches December 9 for PC, in 2026 for PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Soulslike deckbuilder dated.

Soulslike deckbuilder Death Howl will launch for PC via Steam on December 9, followed by PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch in 2026, publisher 11 bit studios and developer The Outer Zone announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via 11 bit studios:

Blending beloved mechanics into something entirely its own, Death Howl is a genre-defying Soulslike deckbuilder that tells the story of Ro, a mother from a shamanic tribe, who refuses to accept the loss of her child. In a desperate act, she descends into the spirit world to fight for a second chance.

Minimalist in presentation but unafraid of raw, harrowing themes, Death Howl unfolds as a metaphorical journey through sorrow, survival and acceptance. It’s a hunt where every step forward carries a cost—and every enemy demands a study worthy of a huntress.

True to soulslike tropes, defeat is not the end, but part of the learning path. Resting revives fallen foes, and understanding enemy behavior is crucial to progress. Death Howl enhances this structure with tactical, grid-based combat, deck-building systems, and action-RPG exploration across eerie, hostile biomes.

Each region introduces not just new enemies and active and passive abilities, but also new cards that offer deck-tailoring possibilities, allowing players to shape their tactical approach as they progress. Every fallen spirit adds to Ro’s strength in this quiet war of grief and resolve.

Will Ro reclaim what was taken from her? Or will the spirit world take her too?

item.title: All These Games Sold Exactly One Copy In The US In October
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Battlefield 6 sold many, many copies in the US in October, but which games sold precisely one copy? As it turns out, lots of games did that.

Circana's Mat Piscatella shared a list of games that sold one physical copy in the US in October, and they include Burnout Paradise for Xbox 360, The Incredibles 2: Rise of the Underminer for Game Boy Advance, and Backyard Baseball for the PlayStation 2.

You can see a longer list below, but note that it's not exhaustive. Some games only sold two copies in October, including Tom Clancy's End War for the PSP.

Something we do not know here is who is buying these games, where they're buying them, or why they're buying them. But Piscatella said it's not out of the ordinary. "Happens every month. There was a copy somewhere in the store for who knows how long," Piscatella said.

Games that sold one physical copy in the US in October:

  • Burnout Paradise (Xbox 360)
  • Carnival Games: Wild West 3D (3DS)
  • The Incredibles 2: Rise of the Underminer (Game Boy Advance)
  • Imagine Fashion Stylist (Nintendo DS)
  • Spore (PC)
  • Backyard Baseball (PS2)
  • Hasbro Family Game Night 3 (PS3)
  • Cooking Mama Cookstar (PS4)
  • Ultra Bust A Move (original Xbox)

As for Battlefield 6's chart-topping results, Circana doesn't share unit-sales data, but the game was No. 1 for October and quickly became the No. 1 best-selling game overall in the US for 2025 so far. Battlefield 6 even outpaced the first-month sales of Black Ops 6 and Modern Warfare 3.
